title: DWTS pro Peta Murgatroyd gets sworn in as US citizen alongside husband Maksim Chmerkovskiy and son
text:
It took 13-years, but Peta Murgatroyd is now one proud American!

The Dancing With The Stars pro was sworn in as an official United States citizen on Tuesday, with her husband Maksim Chmerkovskiy and their two-year-old son Shai by her side.

'Yesterday was an emotional day for me,' Murgatroyd, 33, began in a lengthy caption along with a series of photos taken from her emotional ceremony that she shared on Instagram.

'After countless US Visas starting from 2006 and the last 5 years with a Green Card, I am officially a United States citizen. I'm getting misty eyed writing this, because I haven't reflected on my life up until this point.'

It's official! Peta Murgatroyd celebrated being sworn in as a US citizen On Tuesday, October 8, with her husband, Maksim Chmerkovskiy, by her side

'I went deep down memory lane and I cried at the ceremony and then really cried in private,' the New Zealand born Australian dancer added.

'Memories surfaced that I had forgotten about, wishes that I had made as a child in my backyard with a full moon and promises that I made to myself and my family.'

She went on to talk about how her life came full-circle while 'sitting in an auditorium with 1000 people, with my Ukrainian/American husband and my American son....a girl from little Perth with a big dream of being someone.'

Documented: The DWTS professional dancer shared her feelings and emotions in a lengthy caption along with a series a photos taken from the ceremony

The New Zealand native, who moved to Australia as a toddler, held an American flag in her left hand as she held up her right hand during the emotional ceremony

Patriotic: The DWTS pro, who sat alongside her husband and son Shai, was very emotional about becoming a United States citizen

Murgatroyd also mentioned how she dreamt of 'performing on the world's biggest stage'; 'people knowing my name'; 'being the best at my craft'; 'making a difference in the world'; 'and most of all I dreamt of making my family proud and proving that I could do it at the highest level.'

She went on to say that she loves the life she has created, and that it wouldn't have been possible without the United States giving her a chance to succeed 'and live in the best country in the world, where dreams really do come true.'

She added, 'This country gave me my career, it's where I found the love of my life, and it's where my first child was born. This will always be home now. I looked around at the auditorium full of immigrants....their eyes were longingly filled with hope, faith and belief. I am an immigrant too. I will always be one, and I'm proud of it.'

Sweet smooch: The happy couple sealed the swearing-in ceremony with a kiss

Beaming: Mugatroyd and her son Shai were all smiles as they waved the US flag

Heartfelt: Muragtroyd talked about how her life came full-circle while 'sitting in an auditorium with 1000 people, with my Ukrainian/American husband and my American son'

The Latin dancer concluded by thanking the USA for accepting her.

'I will continue to work and treat this country with the upmost respect. I will honor the flag and The Pledge of Allegiance. I don't take this lightly. God Bless America.'

Murgatroyd's big day on becoming a US citizen came two days after she and her partner Lamar Odom become the second couple to be eliminated from season 28 of Dancing With The Stars.

Going strong: After dating on-and-off since 2012, the couple were married in July 8, 2017

Emotional: 'This country gave me my career, it's where I found the love of my life, and it's where my first child was born. This will always be home now,' Murgatroyd said

Her pledge: Murgatroyd ended her statement by pledging to 'continue to work and treat this country with the upmost respect. I will honor the flag and The Pledge of Allegiance'
